entry.title: A Bipolar Expedition
entry.summary: Paul Downes, a successful businessman with bipolar disorder, invites 12 Ukrainian women to join him at a castle in Jamaica, hoping that one of them can be persuaded to marry him

entry.title: A Boy Called Alex: The Concert
entry.summary: Highlights from the remarkable performance of Bach's St Matthew Passion conducted by Alex Stobbs at London's Cadogan Hall

entry.title: A Cook on the Wild Side
entry.summary: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall spurns the London summer and heads for open country to spend some time eating off the fat of the land in a trawl through Britain's wild larder

entry.title: A Dance to the Music of Time
entry.summary: An adaptation of Anthony Powell's 12-volume novel sequence - a sharp, comic portrait of upper-class and bohemian England, spanning almost a century, from the early 20s to modern times

entry.title: A Harlot's Progress
entry.summary: A Harlot's Progress dramatically depicts the artist William Hogarth's exploration of sex trafficking and debauchery in Georgian London - an investigation that threatens to destroy his career

entry.title: A Jihad for Love
entry.summary: Parvez Sharma's compassionate and moving exploration of Islam and homosexuality talks to men and women of the Muslim faith who are courageous and defiant about their sexuality and choice of lifestyle

entry.title: A Million Pound Place in the Sun
entry.summary: Property expert Amanda Lamb helps affluent house hunters find their luxury dream home

entry.title: A Place by the Sea
entry.summary: Property expert Seetha Hallett shows potential house-buyers fantastic properties right on the British coast

entry.title: A Place in the Sun
entry.summary: The show that helps house hunters find dream holiday homes all over Europe with advice from international property experts

entry.title: A Place in the Sun Down Under
entry.summary: With a cheaper cost of living Australia is becoming more and more popular as a destination for Brits wanting a new life

entry.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
entry.summary: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help property owners find the ideal new homes they've always wanted - but will they stay on British soil or settle on some distant sunny shore?

entry.title: A Very British Coup
entry.summary: Based on the novel by Chris Mullin, this political thriller stars Ray McAnally as the newly elected left-wing prime minister Harry Perkins, who soon finds himself up to his neck in conspiracy

entry.title: A Very British Storm Junkie
entry.summary: Cutting Edge documentary about an unassuming IT consultant who - in his alter ego of fanatical storm chaser - travels thousands of miles across the globe to witness at first hand the awesome power of nature

entry.title: A WI Lady's Guide to Brothels
entry.summary: Middle England meets the sex trade head-on when the Hampshire WI emerges as an unlikely champion of the reform of prostitution laws

entry.title: A Wife for William
entry.summary: Who should be our next queen? Let the Great British Public decide! Vernon Kay hosts the search to find Prince William's bride from 25 eligible girls handpicked by experts.

entry.title: A-Z of Your Head
entry.summary: What's it like to hear voices, make yourself sick 15 times a day, or have electric shock treatment? Young people share their personal experiences of mental health problems.

entry.title: Absolutely
entry.summary: Many years ago, before The Fast Show, Big Train or Little Britain, came this influential Scottish sketch show. A splendid blend of comedy craft and surreal lunacy.

entry.title: The Adam and Joe Show
entry.summary: Hilarious and irreverent comedy from award-winning duo Adam Buxton and Joe Cornish. Featuring inspired toy animations and hard-hitting reports on the youth of today from Adam's dad.

entry.title: Adam and Joe's Fourmative Years
entry.summary: In 1997, Channel 4 called on cult couch-potatoes Adam and Joe to look back over its first 15 years of groundbreaking television. And take the p*ss out of it...

entry.title: Addicted to Surrogacy
entry.summary: This Cutting Edge film explores the extraordinary world of serial surrogates and asks what motivates them to continue to have babies for other people. Is it money, altruism - or something far more complex?

entry.title: Adopt Me - I'm a Teenager
entry.summary: An observational film looking at adoption stories in the USA. The programme features teenagers between the ages of 15-17 who are on an epic emotional journey in search of a permanent family.

entry.title: The Air Hospital
entry.summary: Cutting Edge gets on board the Ministry of Defence's C-17 Globemaster plane as its elite medical staff and pilots bring injured service personnel back from Afghanistan

entry.title: Alan Carr's Celebrity Ding Dong
entry.summary: The award-winning comedian hosts a showbiz bash with a difference. Alan knows celebs are no better than ordinary folk. And he's got the show to prove it!

entry.title: Alan Carr: Tooth Fairy Live
entry.summary: In his sell-out live performance at the Hammersmith Apollo, Alan Carr talks about childhood and adolescence in his trademark frank and hilarious style

entry.title: The Album Chart Show with Tesco Entertainment
entry.summary: The Tesco Entertainment Album Chart Show (formerly The Album Chart Show) is a music programme which features performances from new and established acts at London's Koko club

entry.title: Alex: A Passion for Life
entry.summary: Cutting Edge catches up with Alex Stobbs, the musical prodigy and cystic fibrosis sufferer originally featured in A Boy Called Alex, who is now studying music at Cambridge

entry.title: Alone in the Wild
entry.summary: In this remarkable documentary, Ed Wardle is dropped into the unforgiving Yukon wilderness with just basic provisions and cameras to film himself as he attempts to survive completely alone in the wild

entry.title: Alternative Christmas Message
entry.summary: Replay Channel 4's 2008 Alternative Christmas Message, delivered by the President of Iran, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad

entry.title: The Alternative Queen's Message
entry.summary: In 1993, Channel 4 presented a very distinctive alternative to the queen's speech - a heartfelt Christmas message from New York's famous British émigré Quentin Crisp

entry.title: Ambreen: The Girl Boxer
entry.summary: First Cut follows a young Muslim female boxer's preparations for her championship fight

entry.title: Amish: World's Squarest Teenagers
entry.summary: Five Amish teenagers leave their closed communities in the American mid-West for the very first time, to travel to Britain on an extraordinary cultural exchange

entry.title: The Anatomists
entry.summary: A three-part history of the science of anatomy, from the ancient practice of human vivisection in the Greek Empire to the endemic grave robbing of 19th-century Britain

entry.title: Anatomy for Beginners
entry.summary: Controversial anatomist Dr Gunther von Hagens and pathologist Professor John Lee explore the beauty beneath our skin in a fascinating series of anatomy classes

entry.title: The Ancient World with Bettany Hughes
entry.summary: A new film about Alexandria provides the centrepiece of Bettany Hughes' definitive history of the ancient world and classical civilisation

entry.title: Animal Farm
entry.summary: Presented by Olivia Judson and Giles Coren, this series looks at advancements in GM, cloning and tissue engineering in animals

entry.title: Annie's Bar
entry.summary: Political soap with scenes shot just hours before transmission. Set in and around Annie's Bar - the legendary watering hole and gossip shop in the House of Commons

entry.title: The Antics Roadshow
entry.summary: Banksy's 'incomplete guide to total anarchy' provides a greatest hits of wayward behaviour, sedition and sabotage

entry.title: Any Human Heart
entry.summary: Jim Broadbent, Matthew Macfadyen and Sam Claflin take the lead role in William Boyd's funny, moving and ambitious adaptation of his best-selling novel, exploring one man's tumultuous and unpredictable journey through the 20th century

entry.title: Ape
entry.summary: A comedy show featuring a goofy mix of sketches and hidden-camera stunts where Liam Hourican 'apes' a random bunch of famous faces and everyday people in his own particular style

entry.title: Apocalypse: The Second World War
entry.summary: The story of World War II, told in painstakingly digitally colourised and evocative footage, and through the personal testimony of those who were there

entry.title: Around the World in 80 Trades
entry.summary: With £25,000 in his pocket from the sale of his flat, Conor Woodman travels across four continents, trading in all kinds of products with the aim of doubling his money

entry.title: The Art Show
entry.summary: Contemporary arts strand that offers viewers a series of highly imaginative, provocative and unapologetically irreverent films covering the modern art scene

entry.title: Arthur's Hell on High Water
entry.summary: Many environmentalists would like to see an end to commercial trawler fishing. Arthur Potts Dawson takes to the seas with trawlermen to challenge his preconceptions about commercial fishing

entry.title: The Ascent of Money
entry.summary: Bringing context and understanding to the current economic crisis, historian Niall Ferguson tells the story of money and the rise - and spectacular falls - of global finance throughout the ages

entry.title: Ashes to Diamonds
entry.summary: Filmmaker David Brindley meets families across the country who have chosen some of the most surprising, adventurous and unusual ways to say goodbye to their departed's ashes

entry.title: Asian Gracefully
entry.summary: An intimate look behind the doors of one of the few residential care homes in Britain exclusively for the Asian elderly.

entry.title: Ask the Chancellors
entry.summary: In a live election programme, would-be chancellors Alistair Darling, George Osborne and Vince Cable debate with each other and face questions from the audience and Krishnan Guru-Murthy

entry.title: Athletics: IAAF World Championships 2011
entry.summary: All the action from the world's top athletics championship

entry.title: Athletics: The IAAF World Youth Championships
entry.summary: Highlights from the 2011 meeting in Lille, northern France

entry.title: The Atkins Diet: Fat or Fiction
entry.summary: This documentary explores all sides of the popular - and so-called 'miracle' - diet. From the people who are following it, to the science for and against it.
